objectives: Discuss costs using numbers, amounts, and per-person splits
Use clear structures for estimates, totals, and reimbursements
Confirm agreements with repeat-back and head-nod close

vocab.def: Flat O hand taps palm; COST brushes hand.
Dollar flick from temple; Cent from forehead.
A-hand downward repeated or alternate pointing around group.
Separate hands outward to show division.
Push from palm outward / move money back to person.
Firm NMM; tap time marker for when payment due.

sections.heading: 1) Framing Costs
sections.body: Use **Time â†’ Topic â†’ Comment** for clarity: **THIS WEEK â†’ PARTY BUDGET â†’ ABOUT $120.** Then show parts with a list hand: **FOOD $60, DECOR $30, DRINK $30.**

sections.heading: 2) Split Per-Person
sections.body: Show group size first, then split: **WE 6. TOTAL $120. SPLIT EACH â†’ $20 PER-PERSON.** Use a small pause after each number.

microCheck.q: Most transparent order for cost split:

sections.heading: 3) Pay, Reimburse, Deadline
sections.body: Clarify who fronts money and when others pay back: **I PAY NOW. YOU REIMBURSE ME BY FRIDAY NIGHT.** Add method if needed (**VENMO**, **CASH**).

sections.heading: 4) Partner Drill: Plan & Confirm
sections.body: A proposes budget (total + split + deadline). B repeat-backs the **per-person amount** and **due time**. Swap.
sections.teacherNote: Listen for steady pacing on numbers and a clear close with head-nod.

sections.heading: 5) Scenario Practice
sections.body: Choose one: **field trip**, **club pizza**, or **workshop snacks**. Present total, split, due, and reimbursement method.
